24.08.text: First in the spotlight tonight is the Blue Peter presenter Radzi.

28.92.text: He's answering questions on that great sitcom The Office.

32.92.text: Next, the singer and songwriter Damon Gough,

35.44.text: otherwise known as Badly Drawn Boy.

41.80.text: The actress Rebecca Root answering questions on the novels of Graham Greene.

46.92.text: And the Olympic athlete Kriss Akabusi on West Ham United.

60.56.text: Hello and welcome to Celebrity Mastermind,

64.24.text: with me, John Humphrys, and four celebrities who think

67.36.text: they know everything they need to know about their specialist subjects,

71.36.text: but what they don't know is what affect the black chair will have on them

75.64.text: when they finally get to sit in it.

77.52.text: Their fees go to charity, but the prize for one of them

80.40.text: is the trophy, and the honour of becoming a Mastermind.

84.68.text: The rules are the same, though.

86.12.text: 90 seconds of questions on their specialist subject, and then two minutes on general knowledge.

90.80.text: So, let us get on with it, and ask our first contender to join us, please.

107.72.text: The Office. Here we go. 90 seconds.

110.56.text: The mockumentary sitcom The Office was written and directed

113.16.text: by Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant,

114.88.text: and depicts the day-to-day lives of employees

116.88.text: at the paper merchants Wernham Hogg.

118.48.text: What is the title of the show's theme song?

124.04.text: At the start of the second series, the Slough branch of Wernham Hogg

126.88.text: incorporates the staff of another branch in which town?

129.56.text:
- Swindon. 
- Yep. After the office quiz,

131.40.text: Finchy forces David Brent to admit that instead of Fidel Castro,

134.64.text: he gave a ridiculous answer to the question, "Name the Cuban leader

137.48.text: "who's been in power since the Revolution of 1959."

142.52.text: When Brent is made redundant and sues Wernham Hogg,

144.72.text: the UK manager, Neil Godwin makes it clear that Brent's social calls

148.16.text: are no longer welcome. What is the name of Brent's dog,

150.48.text: who's also barred from the office?

153.28.text: To raise money for Comic Relief, Brent gives an impromptu demonstration

156.40.text: of his dance moves, which he describes as a fusion of MC Hammer with which film?

162.88.text: who interviews Brent for the trade magazine Inside Paper?

168.52.text: When Brent sees that Gareth is wearing a holster to

170.80.text: hold his mobile phone, he does an impression of which film actor?

173.88.text:
- Clint Eastwood. 
- Yes, playing Dirty Harry.

176.08.text: When Brent is preparing for his motivational talks,

178.36.text: he asks Gareth to throw insults at him,

180.60.text: and he discovers that because of his appearance, his nicknames around the office

184.04.text: are Mr Toad and also which cartoon character?

187.76.text: On Keith from accounts' appraisal form,

189.56.text: he lists accounts as his only strength.

191.84.text: What does he put under weaknesses?

194.48.text: What Secret Santa gift does Dawn get from Tim

197.00.text: at the Christmas party, together with a note saying, "Never give up."

222.36.text:
- And your name is... 
- Damon Gough.

224.52.text:
- Your chosen charity. 
- The WESC Foundation.

227.60.text:
- And your specialist subject. 
- The career and life of Bruce Springsteen.

231.72.text: Bruce Springsteen, in 90 seconds, here we go.

234.28.text: Which music critic, who later became Springsteen's manager and producer,

239.16.text: and wrote "I saw rock and roll future and its name is Bruce Springsteen?"

244.76.text: At which London venue did Springsteen make his UK debut in November 1975?

251.12.text: Springsteen was reputedly inspired to become a musician

253.68.text: after watching a performance by Presley,

255.92.text: on which Sunday night television variety show?

259.72.text: Who replaced Ernest Boom Carter as the drummer in Springsteen's backing group,

263.12.text: The E Street Band, in the summer of 1974?

266.92.text: Which track on Springsteen's 1975 album Born To Run was originally called The Heist

271.20.text: and depicts two small-time criminals preparing for a robbery?

275.76.text: Who was Springsteen's manager with whom he had a long legal dispute

278.96.text: which seriously limited his recording output in 1976 and '77?

284.44.text: What is the title of Springsteen's 1998 four-CD box set of rare outtakes

288.24.text: and other previously unreleased material from recording sessions?

292.80.text: Who does Springsteen pull up on stage and dance with

295.04.text: in Brian De Palma's video for Dancing In The Dark?

297.16.text: She went on to star in Friends.

299.72.text: Which song on Springsteen's debut album, Greetings From Asbury Park, NJ,

303.92.text: "I was the king of the alley, mama, I could talk some trash.

306.36.text: "I was the prince of the paupers, crowned downtown at the beggar's bash."

309.44.text:
- It's Hard To Be A Saint In The City. 
- Yes.

311.08.text: The title song of which '95 album was inspired by, and makes references to,

315.08.text: John Steinbeck's novel The Grapes of Wrath?

318.60.text:
- The Ghost of Tom Joad. 
- Yeah.

319.92.text: What is the title of Springsteen's album, released in January 2014,

322.84.text: which contains outtakes, covers and reworkings... BEEP ..of his own songs?

328.08.text:
- A Promise. 
- Oh, what a shame, no. High Hopes.

331.04.text:
- But, nonetheless, you've got, Damon, 10 points. 
- Thank you.

352.92.text:
- And your name is... 
- Rebecca Root.

361.52.text: Graham Greene's novels, in 90 seconds. Here we go.

364.16.text: In Our Man In Havana, the everyday occupation of James Wormold who was offered work with

367.88.text: the British Secret Services selling what household item?

371.92.text: In Brighton Rock, what's the name of the older gang member who was uncomfortable with

375.52.text: the growing violence of the mob?

376.92.text: Pinkie kills him so the murder of Charles Hale can't be reported.

380.76.text: In the Heart of the Matter, Edward Wilson and his housemate Harris

383.56.text: quarrel about the rules of engagement for hunting what insects?

387.36.text: What's the profession of Mr Tench, who befriends a nameless priest

390.20.text: after meeting him at the quayside in The Power and the Glory?

392.80.text:
- He's a dentist. 
- He is. In The End of the Affair, after Sarah Myles dies from a fever,

396.24.text: her husband, Henry, invites Sarah's lover Morris to take any memento from her desk.

402.00.text: In The Heart of the Matter, Major Scobie tries to arrange for his wife

404.92.text: to travel for another country where she thinks she'll be happier.

407.72.text: What country does she want to go to?

409.24.text:
- South Africa. 
- Yep. In Travels With My Aunt, what flower does Henry Pulling

412.40.text: tell his Aunt Augusta he spends his time cultivating when he meets her

415.36.text: at his mother's funeral after many years separation?

417.72.text:
- Dahlias. 
- Yeah. In Dr Fisher of Geneva, at the first party that Alfred Jones attends,

421.28.text: he's told the guests who obey instructions received expensive gifts

424.48.text: at the end of the meal. What must they eat to get their prize?

428.40.text: What does Pinkie Brown tell Rose was splashed in the eyes and face

431.16.text: of Peggy Barton to spoil her looks?

434.88.text: In The Human Factory, Davis's secretary appears upset at her boss's funeral,

439.20.text: causing Dr Percival to explain to Morris that Davis was in love with her.

445.28.text: Detective Sgt Sparrow confiscates Henry Pulling's mother's ashes

448.52.text: and has them tested, revealing that something has been mixed in

451.32.text: with them in the urn. What?

454.48.text: Alfred Jones attends... BEEP ..Dr Fisher's last party where guests must

458.28.text: pick a cracker. One has a bomb in it.

460.20.text: The others each contain a cheque for how many francs?

462.96.text:
- Two million Swiss francs. 
- Yeah. Absolutely.

465.56.text: You got them all right. 12 points.

488.32.text:
- And your chosen subject. 
- The mighty West Ham!

491.52.text: West Ham, in 90 seconds. Starting now.

494.24.text: What position of the First Division did West Ham finish at the end of the 1985-86 season?

498.72.text: It's their highest position in the top division.

502.20.text: What was the score after extra time of the 2006 FA Cup final against Liverpool?

505.96.text: The Hammers lost the penalty shoot out by three penalties to one.

511.20.text: Which club did West Ham beat at Wembley in the Championship play-off final

514.92.text: in 2012 after finishing third in the league?

519.28.text: Which Argentinian international signed for the club in August 2006

522.96.text: at the same time as Carlos Tevez?

526.60.text: In 2008, the number six shirt famously worn by Bobby Moore was retired.

529.88.text: Which defender, who then took the number 15 shirt,

532.40.text: was the last to wear number six?

536.36.text: Who was West Ham's leading Premier League goal-scorer

544.44.text: Which defender joined West Ham from Fiorentina in September 2001,

548.08.text: but was sent off on his debut against Middlesbrough

550.28.text: and then received another red card in his third game for the club

556.44.text: At which stadium in April 2007 did West Ham become the first

559.32.text: away team to win a competitive game?

560.92.text: Their next victory, though, was in the first game

567.24.text: Which club bought Rio Ferdinand from West Ham in 2000 for £18 million,

571.32.text: a record for a defender at the time?

574.24.text: West Ham played in the Premier League for ten seasons in a row

576.92.text: following promotion in '93. Who was the manager for seven of those seasons?

582.12.text: In 2010, who was appointed vice-chairman of West Ham

584.36.text: by the club's... BEEP ..new owners David Sullivan and David Gold,

587.16.text: and also joined the board of the television programme The Apprentice?

592.00.text: You had a few passes, Kriss.

594.64.text: It was the Emirates Stadium where they became the first away team to win a competitive game.

599.08.text: The rather naughty defender who got all those red cards was Tomas Repka,

604.00.text: and Matthew Upson wore the number 6 and then the number 15 shirt.

609.76.text:
- You've scored, Kriss, 7 points. 
- Thank you very much.

621.24.text: Well, some very good scoring there.

623.20.text: Let's have a look at all the scores.

624.76.text: In fourth place, 7 points, Kriss Akabusi.

641.72.text: And it is the general knowledge round now,

643.92.text: and if there is a tie at the end of it,

645.52.text: then the number of passes is taken into account,

647.56.text: and the person with the fewer passes is the winner,

649.76.text: so let's get on with it, and ask Kriss to join us again, please.

653.12.text: And, something I've always wanted to ask you,

656.72.text: you were the third-best sprinter in the world.

659.68.text: Not in Britain, in the world. And you seemed to be disappointed with that?

664.68.text: I mean, certainly when you start off in your career, you know,

667.28.text: you want to be the best in your country,

669.32.text: then you become the best in Europe, and it's great,

671.76.text: and then you try to be the best in the world.

673.60.text: Every now and again, you look up, no-one's there, everyone's down there.

676.72.text: For me, I got to third, looked up, there's two people, I said,

680.68.text: Just a quick word about athletics.

682.68.text: Very, very different world today to what the amateur world was.

688.84.text: Better for the sport, I mean.

691.00.text: Well, I mean, obviously, there's been a lot of scandal this year. Um...

696.44.text: You know, you want to be pure, but you also... I think...

699.40.text: It is a good idea that someone who dedicates 15 years of life to

702.56.text: something, that they actually can make a living out of it too,

705.16.text: so I don't begrudge the people who are making good money today.

708.44.text: If you're someone like Usain Bolt for example,

710.68.text: and you bring so much joy and you do such phenomenal stuff,

713.16.text: you shouldn't have to work again when you finish your sport.

717.40.text: Right, well, now, you already have 7 points, and you now have

721.72.text: a whole two minutes to zoom ahead with your general knowledge.

727.36.text: John Lydon, better known as Johnny Rotten,

729.28.text: was the lead singer with which punk band from 1975 to '78?

734.08.text: Which variety of English blue cheese traditionally accompanies port?

739.04.text: In which five-a-side sport are players not allowed to run with the ball

742.08.text: without bouncing it? If they do, the offence is called travelling.

746.12.text: Whose struggles with her love life and her weight are catalogued in her diaries

749.48.text: written by the novelist Helen Fielding?

755.76.text: In which 1993 film is it always 2nd February for Bill Murray's character, Phil?

759.64.text: He wakes up every morning to Sonny and Cher singing I Got You Babe

765.64.text:
- Back To The future? 
- Er...Groundhog Day.

767.72.text: In which English county do the town of Matlock and the village of Matlock Bath

777.48.text: In Greek mythology, who was given 12 labours as a punishment

780.80.text: for killing his wife and children in a fit of madness?

784.60.text: In 1954, Christopher Chataway became the first winner of

791.24.text: Which semiaquatic mammal which belongs to the weasel family

794.60.text: lives in a den called a halt?

797.56.text: In 2014, the billionaire Steve Wynn paid a reported 28 million

801.60.text: for Jeff Koons' sculpture of a spinach-eating sailor.

806.84.text: What did the letter U stand for in the name of the German

819.28.text: No, well, Untersee, but there we are.

821.20.text: In literature, by what collective name are

827.24.text: The name of which branch of science, which includes zoology and botany,

830.28.text: comes from the Greek for life and the word or reason.

835.56.text: Sir Frederick Ashton, who was born in Ecuador in 1904

838.32.text: and died in England in 1988, was a leading figure in which area of the arts?

843.64.text: Who became the youngest Chancellor of the Exchequer for more than 100 years

846.88.text: when he was appointed to the position... BEEP ..after the 2010 general election?

855.12.text: Really wanted it to be him, but it wasn't to be.

859.68.text: it was ballet that Sir Frederick Ashton was a bit of a star at.

866.92.text: Chris Chataway became BBC Sports Personality Of The Year, the first one.

870.60.text: Hercules was the bloke who was given 12 labours for killing his wife and children.

874.52.text: And Bridget Jones wrote the famous diary, but you knew that.

879.24.text: It's sitting in the chair that does it, I tell you.

881.60.text:
- Kriss, you now have a total of 12 points. 
- Thank you very much.

895.96.text: And you start out with 9 points, Radzi.

901.24.text: Um... Some things have changed, but most things haven't.

904.08.text: I mean, you still make things and you still do challenges.

909.08.text: and it's kind of the stalwart of Children's BBC, I guess,

912.04.text: and it's a privilege to be on it,

913.40.text: but it's still fundamentally the same, we hope to inspire kids and...

916.40.text: You don't still have sticky back plastic and loo rolls,

919.00.text: though, do you? Or do you?

920.24.text: Loo rolls, we do, sticky back plastic, we sometimes do!

923.04.text: But, yeah, the makes really vary -

926.52.text: we make things similar to that and try and keep it a legendary show.

929.52.text: And the challenges, are they more daring than they were?

932.88.text: Although they were pretty daring in the old days!

935.32.text: Yeah, I think we have been daring throughout.

937.28.text: For me personally, I have got to swim Lake Windermere,

939.76.text: I have climbed the tallest man-made climbing wall in the world,

942.60.text: which is a dam in Switzerland called the Diga di Luzzone.

945.16.text:
- Crumbs! How high is that? 
- 165 metres.

949.44.text: So, yeah, there was little old me, ten training sessions,

952.84.text: off I go to Switzerland and hopefully scale this big wall.

956.88.text: And is there one challenge you think, they are going to ring me

959.60.text: one day and say, "We want you to..."

961.12.text: and you're going to say, "Uh-uh, no, couldn't do that"?

963.76.text:
- I've got a thing about sharks. 
- Ah!

967.44.text: I don't really want to get in any water with any sharks.

969.84.text: I really like the land, I like how gravity works on my body,

972.72.text: I will leave sharks to what they do, so, I don't want that call,

975.48.text:
- but anything else, I'm game for. 
- Well, long may it last.

978.44.text: Well, then, Radzi, you've got nine points already in the can, let's

982.20.text: see how you do with your general knowledge, two minutes of questions.

990.96.text: Arthur Conan Doyle. What name for the strong, black coffee,

993.92.text: usually served in very small cups, comes from the Italian for "pressed out"?

998.92.text: Espresso. What must you be able to read at 20 metres in good daylight

1002.24.text: as part of the UK driving test?

1006.20.text: The hero of a 1940 Disney animated film is a puppet brought to life

1010.00.text: and is later turned into a real boy by the Blue Fairy. Which film?

1015.32.text: Which mountain arose on a single night in 286 BC,

1024.88.text: Mount Fuji. Buster Merryfield played which character

1027.80.text: in Only Fools and Horses from 1985-96?

1032.32.text: Uncle Albert. How many lines does the poetic verse form the sonnet traditionally have?

1040.40.text: 14. Published in 2000, Down Under is an account of

1043.72.text: which American travel writer's visit to Australia?

1048.72.text: Bill Bryson. Which financial institution has been based

1056.96.text: What type of drinking vessel originally had a rounded base

1060.36.text: and so, as its name suggests, it couldn't stand upright?

1065.32.text: Which British bird, a member of the crow family,

1068.04.text: has distinctive black and white colouring and a long tail?

1072.40.text: Magpie. A group of show business friends that included Dean Martin,

1075.40.text: Peter Lawford and Sammy Davis Jr

1076.88.text: were known as the Rat Pack. Who was the group's leader?

1083.36.text: Which musical, written by Willy Russell, is set in Liverpool

1086.52.text: and features the songs Easy Terms, Marilyn Monroe and Tell Me It's Not True?

1091.60.text: In education, the A in A-levels stands for what?

1096.24.text: Advanced. Which British rock band entered the UK album charts

1099.84.text: at number one for the first time in June 1997 with OK Computer?

1104.84.text: Radiohead. In which month does the Queen celebrate her official birthday...

1108.56.text: BEEP ..with the Trooping of the Colour?

1114.84.text: Close, it was June. Or rather, it is June, because she still does it.

1118.04.text: Your passes - that musical by Willy Russell was Blood Brothers.

1122.60.text: The Bank of England has been in Threadneedle Street since 1734.

1126.36.text:
- Oh! 
- And here is the fascinating one, that drinking vessel... 
- Yeah?

1133.60.text: But who knew that tumblers were called tumblers because...

1136.68.text: This chair does strange things to the brain!

1138.88.text: It does, no question about that!

1140.36.text:
- Radzi, you've got a total now of 12 points. 
- Thank you.

1156.72.text: I don't know whether to call you Badly Drawn Boy or what!

1161.16.text: I mean, why Badly Drawn Boy? I'm sure everyone has asked you that.

1164.16.text:
- Call me what you like, John. 
- Yeah? 
- You are the presenter of Mastermind!

1167.16.text: I know, but I still don't know why you're called Badly Drawn Boy.

1170.28.text: It was just a name that I made up, um,

1173.48.text: over a bottle of wine one night...

1175.56.text: I think it had gone off, the bottle of wine, this name just came

1179.12.text: out of nowhere, and I hated it, but it kind of served me well for

1182.28.text: a few years and I won the Mercury Prize and things like that, which...

1185.68.text: Didn't want to just sneak that in there!

1187.68.text: Well, no need to sneak it in, because I was going to ask about that.

1191.16.text:
- You won it for The Hour of Bewilderbeest. 
- That's right.

1193.72.text: What does it do to you when you are setting out on a career,

1196.40.text: as it were, and you win THE prize, the big prize?

1199.00.text: It just makes you really big headed and unbearable to be around!

1204.04.text: It was like, you couldn't really plan for something like that

1207.48.text: to happen. I was dead proud of it.

1209.40.text: In fact, you are now touring again, aren't you, with Bewilderbeest?

1212.36.text: Yeah, this year was the 15th anniversary of the first album,

1216.96.text: that won the Mercury Prize, so I wanted to sort of pay

1220.36.text: reverence to it, because I think at the time I was just...

1222.96.text: I was bowled over by it all,

1224.76.text: so it's been a really nice year in terms of playing that record again

1228.60.text: at some gigs and say thanks to people for keeping

1231.40.text:
- it in their lives. 
- Well, it made a mark, that's for sure.

1235.32.text: Now, talking about making marks, you have 10 points as we start, so,

1241.12.text: it's going to be a fight to the death, I think,

1245.24.text: So, here we go, two minutes of general knowledge, starting now.

1248.12.text: In which American states are the cities of Dallas and Houston?

1253.00.text: Which Roman leader was murdered in a conspiracy led by Brutus and Cassius?

1257.72.text: Which designer dog breed is a cross between a cocker spaniel and a miniature poodle?

1263.28.text: Yup, cockapoo! What name is used both for a group of singers

1266.72.text: and for the part of the church where they sit in stalls?

1271.96.text: Choir! In a Grimm's fairy story, who finds a cottage with

1275.52.text: the table laid for seven after she's abandoned in a forest?

1280.36.text: It is. Which of the planets of the solar system is the only one not named after

1284.24.text: a Greek or Roman god or goddess?

1287.76.text: The 1955 film The Trouble With Harry is a black comedy by a director

1291.00.text: nicknamed The Master Of Suspense. Which director?

1295.96.text: The '55 film The Trouble With Harry is a black comedy by a director

1299.36.text: nicknamed The Master Of Suspense. Who was he?

1303.28.text: What annual ladies' race has been run at Olney

1305.72.text: in Buckinghamshire on Shrove Tuesday since 1445?

1309.88.text: In the TV series Doc Martin, who plays the socially challenged Cornish GP

1313.52.text: Martin Ellingham, who has an unfortunate phobia of blood?

1323.64.text: what is the usual meat content of a stew known as a navarin?

1331.08.text: Lamb. In internet and text-messaging slang, what expression,

1334.00.text: denoting amusement, does the abbreviation LOL usually stand for?

1340.20.text: Laugh out loud. In Rudyard Kipling's The Jungle Book,

1343.00.text: what is the name of the sleepy brown bear who protects the man cub, Mowgli?

1349.44.text: I'm laughing at the question before!

1351.72.text: Just get on with this one, you're wasting time!

1356.32.text: Baloo! What is the title of Slade's 1973 Christmas number one,

1360.68.text: which has been reissued every decade since?

1363.44.text: So Here It Is, Merry Christmas.

1366.60.text: Which narrow sea extends about 1,400 miles in a southeasterly direction...

1370.72.text: BEEP ..from the Egyptian port of Suez?

1378.48.text:
- Close(!) 
- Just so I don't pass, that's all I'm saying that for.

1383.56.text: Anyway, it's wrong, as you will not be surprised to hear. The Red Sea!

1405.52.text: And 17 is the score you've got to beat

1409.64.text: if you're going to become our Mastermind,

1412.28.text: but let's talk about your sitcom, BBC Two sitcom, Boy Meets Girl,

1417.92.text: and you've done something no actor's ever done before,

1421.20.text: you are a transgender person playing a transgender role.

1428.20.text: Um, it has, but not to the extent that my character in this show has,

1433.84.text: she is a lead role, one of the key characters in the series,

1439.64.text: and hitherto, trans characters have been relegated somewhat to

1445.60.text: the sidelines and maybe only appeared in one or two episodes,

1448.64.text: and even then, just as a very small part.

1451.04.text: Usually the butt of the joke, actually, so...

1453.52.text: And you're not, I mean, in this case, and anyway,

1456.52.text: it's not a cruel comedy, is it? It's a gentle sitcom.

1460.68.text: Yeah, very much, yes, we describe it as a rom-com or a comedy drama,

1465.12.text: and I think it is our intention to make people laugh

1470.08.text: and maybe cry a little bit or hold their breath and go, "Ah!"

1473.72.text: and, you know, just take them on a little rollercoaster.

1476.16.text: And Boy Meets Girl is coming back?

1477.92.text: We hope so, yes, fingers crossed!

1481.92.text: Now, then, the latest challenge is to beat the score of 17,

1485.96.text: which is up there at the moment,

1488.80.text: and you have two minutes of general knowledge in which to do it.

1491.92.text: Which dramatist's works include the tragedies Hamlet and Macbeth?

1496.16.text: The title of Billy Ocean's 1986 number one hit single

1498.56.text: is When The Going Gets Tough, The Tough Get...?

1501.88.text: What word for a regular payment to an employee

1503.88.text: comes from the Latin for the money a Roman soldier was given to buy salt?

1508.40.text: Which 2015 Pixar film features a girl called Riley, who has been uprooted from

1512.68.text: the Midwest to San Francisco, and her emotions, Joy, Sadness, Disgust, Fear and Anger?

1518.16.text: Inside Out. Which English singer-songwriter wrote

1520.52.text: the music for the stage version of the film Billy Elliott?

1528.56.text: as a sideshow to the Paris World Fair?
